Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{2: '???', 3: "What's the meaning of this? Why did they mention Amberia's name?!"}
{2: '???', 3: "Oh. You think I'm playing her like a puppet?"}
{2: '???', 3: "I can only influence her dreams. I can't control her directly."}
{2: '???', 3: "Then what's the deal with the bionics?!"}
{2: '???', 3: "I only said I'd give you a chance, not work with you as an equal. If you want me to uphold my end of the promise, you'd better go harder at it, dear."}
{2: '???', 3: "Seems like you really want out, Amberia. Don't you?"}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory91.png'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Staessen', 3: 'You people... What are you trying to get outta me...', 4: '1'}
{3: "After confirming that the area around the stronghold was safe, we found the Captain Staessen according to Rosetta's proposal and asked him about Amberia."}
{3: 'You had expected some clues or answers, but the result was unexpected.'}
{3: "Upon hearing Amberia's name, Staessen immediately dismissed the guards with an apprehensive expression on his face. He must know something."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Atiel', 3: "You... You can't possibly know about Amberia, can you?!", 4: '2'}
{3: "Atiel could not help but lose her temper over Staessen's inane muttering. She stomps forth and grabs his collar."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Simon', 3: "Stop, Atiel! He's on our side!", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Atiel lets go, but gives Staessen a piercing glare.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rosetta', 3: 'So what is it? Is Amberia still alive?', 4: '1'}
{2: "We need to know everything that's going on.", 3: '24', 4: 'Do you want to relive that tragedy?', 5: '25'}
{2: 'Staessen', 3: "What's the point? It's not like you can do anything about it. This will just be like the previous tides, it'll come to an end soon... Ah...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Staessen', 3: 'There won\'t be no "tragedy." We easily snuffed out the last tide, and we\'ll do it again this time... Ah...', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Diana', 3: 'So, she really is alive then?', 4: '1'}
{3: "Staessen's broken mumblings confirm the suspicions within your heart."}
{2: 'Diana', 3: 'Tell me, Captain. Why did you try to cover it up? Where is she now? How can you tolerate this?!', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Diana let out her anger in a rare sight of rage, proving the significance of her name to the Forest Guard.'}
{2: 'Staessen', 3: "...I wasn't trying to cover it up. No, I never did!", 4: '2'}

{2: 'Staessen', 3: 'It was the previous captain, and the ones before. THEY did that! Every new captain is ordered to keep it a secret. If I had known this from the beginning, I would never have tried to be one!', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Like a crumbling tower, Staessen grabs and pulls at his hair, shrieking angrily at you and the others.'}
{2: 'Then, can you tell us the truth?', 3: '34', 4: 'Why keep it a secret then?', 5: '35'}
{2: 'Staessen', 3: "...Ugh, why'd it turn out like this?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Staessen', 3: "I wasn't trying to! But who'd believe me? And you know what happens to traitors!", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Staessen', 3: "Not to mention, if I were to tell everyone that Amberia was still alive, the ARU would delve into chaos. If we ran into any trouble during so, we'd all...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Staessen', 3: "...Oh, forget it! I don't care anymore! You wanna know the truth, I'll tell you truth! But you better not tell anyone else!", 4: '2'}
{3: 'The room falls into silence. Staessen begins spitting out everything he knows.'}
{2: 'Staessen', 3: "I don't know exactly HOW, but the ARU used a code to suppress Amberia.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Simon', 3: 'A code... So some kind of preset authentication?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Staessen', 3: 'Something like that... Anyway, the leaders in control of the code put Amberia into a deep sleep. They then sealed her and the bionics away somewhere in this tundra.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Staessen', 3: "...First things first though. I don't know where either.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Atiel', 3: "...How can you NOT KNOW? You're not messing with us, are you?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Staessen', 3: "I REALLY DON'T! All I heard from the previous captain was that Amberia's nightmares are what's controlling the tide.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Simon', 3: 'The nightmares are disturbing her M.I.N.D., causing the linked bionics to attack people on the surface?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Staessen', 3: "That's what should be the case this time round as well. The bionics also mentioned Amberia, yeah?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Staessen', 3: 'When her nightmare ends, she will return to her deep slumber. That will put the bionics to rest.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Simon', 3: "That doesn't seem likely.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Simon', 3: 'Before that, I need to confirm something, Boss. Did you see bionics carrying away energy tanks before our rendezvous?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'You mean the energy tanks in the base...?', 3: '51', 4: "What do you think they're planning?", 5: '52'}
{2: 'Simon', 3: "Yeah, that's what I was in a hurry to confirm just now. Most of the energy in the base were stolen.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Simon', 3: 'They must be trying to activate some sort of special machine.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Staessen', 3: "Wait... You don't mean? They're hauling the energy tanks to Amberia?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Simon', 3: "Not much else they'd need so many energy tanks for, I'm afraid... Looks like sleeping beauty is about to wake up.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Staessen', 3: "No... That can't be. If she awakens, there's no way we can defeat her. She must be trying to get revenge on the ARU...", 4: '2'}
{3: "The pace of Staessen's speech quickens, growing more erratic by the second. He tries to scamper for the shipyard, but is blocked off by Rosetta."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Rosetta', 3: "We'll have to fight to see if we win or lose. But for now, we still have a way out... The code... Do you really not have any idea about it?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Staessen', 3: "...You might find something in the research lab. I'm sure you Forest Guards are familiar with it—the lab used to make Constructs.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Staessen', 3: "I don't know what's in there, but you should hurry. If you can find the code, we can put Amberia back to sleep again.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: "...Whether she'll be resurrected or not, as long as we have the code, we will always have the upper hand... Right?", 4: '1'}
{2: "Well then, let's go search for the code.", 3: '61', 4: 'Do we still have time?', 5: '62'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: 'Heh, we think alike.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Rosetta', 3: "No other choice, Commandant. Let's get going.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Atiel', 3: "She's right, Boss. Let's get other Constructs to fortify a defensive line while we look for the code!", 4: '1'}
